"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a32c2863687251bf0005e1#post_55a32c2863687251bf0005e1
To me multiverse theory makes it easier. 
Instead of hopping back in time and disrupting events that have already happened you're hopping to another universe where it hasn't happened yet and even with uc9's frozen river theory it could have been ordained that you having entered that universe and effecting events was meant to happen(of rather had already happened)

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a32e0963687277400006f0#post_55a32e0963687277400006f0
I think the real problem then would be finding it, assuming you had some kind of portal.

Infinite possibilies, only portal to look at one at a time.


Basically say trying to find MLP world; it would be hard cause there's infinite worlds, so you have the same infintesimal chance to stumble onto that as you do barney the dino, a universe full of empty planets, or a alternate WW1
topics.author: 500757fd7f123b75a90003b1

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a32e0163687277400006ea#post_55a32e0163687277400006ea
There's no evidence for the multiverse theory because quantum particles don't effect general relativity.

To make it simple: no evidence of parallel timelines because physics on the incredibly small level is completely foreign to physics on the incredibly large level.  Physics on the incredibly small level is completely foreign to how most people think physics work cause it follows a different set of rules than physics on the large scale.  If you go into a subatomic physics class going "oh I know general physics; this will be easy!" you'll get a 0; not a D or even a F just a 0 on every assignment.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a32ec2636872681d0003a2#post_55a32ec2636872681d0003a2
The biggest problem with portals between universes would be this:
!http://stream1.gifsoup.com/view2/2388130/portal-2-moon-shot-o.gif!

But instead of the atmosphere imagine your entire world getting instantly sucked through.

In order for someone to travel between universes they would first have to leave the entire home universe all together then re-enter a new universe.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a32ec2636872681d0003a2#post_55a32ec2636872681d0003a2
Imagine being able to read the minds of the people about to open the First observation portal to another univers

Scientist one: "I'm going to be famous! I won't have to work a day in my life after this!"
Scientist two: "I hope there's life! I hope it's intelligent! Imagine! Me! The first human to make contact with an extrauniversal organism!"
Scientist three: "I hope everything goes well. I don't want to be known as the man who unleashed literal hell on earth"
Scientist four: "please be furries please be furries please be furries"

"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a328cb6368726775000be6#post_55a328cb6368726775000be6
the idea of religion is upon belief, something that you hold on and believe in on a spiritual level. you can say that "oh someone just thought up of a god and everyone believed it" but thats just generalizing the idea. some people need a god in their life because it helps them guide themselves through not just a physical way but in a spiritual way as well. if you dont believe in it, thats fine i understand, but please do at least understand the ideology behind religion in a much more in depth manner before saying stuff like that. of course the ideology of religion goes deeper than i have explained but i dont feel like diving much further at this moment.
